snippet: Other data showed a drop in new claims for unemployment benefits last week, although a storm that battered the East Coast distorted the figures.
abstract: Commerce Department reports United States trade deficit unexpectedly shrank by 5.1 percent in September, to $41.55 billion, smallest shortfall since December 2010; exports rose 3.1 percent, offsetting 1.5 percent rise in imports; attributes shift to a sharp rise in exports, suggesting global demand for American goods was holding up despite Europe's debt crisis.
lead_paragraph: Other data showed a drop in new claims for unemployment benefits last week, although a storm that battered the East Coast distorted the figures.

headline.seo: U.S. Trade Deficit Narrows as Exports Climb
headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Narrows As Exports Climb Sharply
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Deficit Narrows As Exports Climb Sharply
